related.meaning: eldest son (may be the only son)
head (chief, director) of a section or department

lessons.japanese: パウエル米国国務長官の来日中、事件は起こった。
lessons.english: The incident occurred while Secretary of State, Powell, was visiting Japan.

lessons.japanese: 彼の公式の肩書きは環境庁長官です。
lessons.english: His official title is Director-General of the Environment Agency.

lessons.japanese: 長官は彼に全権を委任した。
lessons.english: The governor invested him with full authority.

lessons.japanese: 大統領は彼を国務長官に指名した。
lessons.english: The President nominated him to be Secretary of State.

lessons.japanese: 国務長官は対外関係を統括する。
lessons.english: The Secretary of State administers foreign affairs.

lessons.japanese: 国務長官は対外関係を統括する。
lessons.english: The Secretary of State administers foreign affairs.

lessons.japanese: 大統領は彼を国務長官に指名した。
lessons.english: The President nominated him to be Secretary of State.

lessons.japanese: 長官は彼に全権を委任した。
lessons.english: The governor invested him with full authority.

lessons.japanese: 彼の公式の肩書きは環境庁長官です。
lessons.english: His official title is Director-General of the Environment Agency.

lessons.japanese: パウエル米国国務長官の来日中、事件は起こった。
lessons.english: The incident occurred while Secretary of State, Powell, was visiting Japan.
